problem:

choices:
Choices:
  A: Half of the country is both humid and cold.
  B: Most of the country is hot.
  C: Some parts of the country are neither cold nor humid.
  D: It is not possible to raise cacti in the country.

response:
Thought:

This means that most parts of the country are either not humid (suitable for cacti) or not cold (suitable for orange trees). Therefore, the statement that most parts of the country are humid (which would make it difficult to grow cacti) must be false.

problem:
Which one of the following arguments is most similar in its pattern of reasoning to that used by the radio producer?
Choices:
  A: We should either buy blinds for the windows or make full-length curtains. Blinds would be very expensive to purchase. Thus, if cost is our greatest concern, we should make curtains.
  B: We should either make curtains for the windows or buy blinds. Since the windows are not standard sizes, if we buy blinds we will have to special order them. Since we do not have time to wait for special orders, we should make the curtains.
  C: For the living room windows, we can make curtains or valances or both. We want to have privacy; and while curtains provide privacy, valances do not. So we should make curtains but not valances.
  D: Since we have very little fabric, we will have to either buy more, or make valances instead of curtains. However, if we use this fabric to make valances, then we will have to buy blinds. Since it would be hard to buy fabric that matches what we already have, we should buy blinds.
  E: We should either buy blinds or make curtains for the windows. If we buy blinds but do not make valances, the windows will look bare. We should not have bare windows. So if we do not make the curtains, we should make the valances.
choices:
Choices:
  A: We should either buy blinds for the windows or make full-length curtains. Blinds would be very expensive to purchase. Thus, if cost is our greatest concern, we should make curtains.
  B: We should either make curtains for the windows or buy blinds. Since the windows are not standard sizes, if we buy blinds we will have to special order them. Since we do not have time to wait for special orders, we should make the curtains.
  C: For the living room windows, we can make curtains or valances or both. We want to have privacy; and while curtains provide privacy, valances do not. So we should make curtains but not valances.
  D: Since we have very little fabric, we will have to either buy more, or make valances instead of curtains. However, if we use this fabric to make valances, then we will have to buy blinds. Since it would be hard to buy fabric that matches what we already have, we should buy blinds.
  E: We should either buy blinds or make curtains for the windows. If we buy blinds but do not make valances, the windows will look bare. We should not have bare windows. So if we do not make the curtains, we should make the valances.
response:
Thought: 
The radio producer's argument is based on a choice between two options, where one option (sticking with classical music) presents a risk (going out of business) that they are not willing to take. Therefore, they choose the other option (devoting airtime to more popular genres). 
Looking at the choices, option B presents a similar pattern of reasoning. They have a choice between two options (making curtains or buying blinds), one of which (buying blinds) presents a problem (having to wait for special orders) that they are not willing to deal with. Therefore, they choose the other option (making curtains).
Action: Answer("B")

problem:

choices:
Choices:
  A: None of our feelings are within our control.
  B: People should not make promises to do something that is not within their control.
  C: "Love" can legitimately be taken to refer to something other than feelings.
  D: Promises should not be interpreted in such a way that they make no sense.
  E: Promises that cannot be kept do not make any sense.
response:
Thought: 
The ethicist's argument is that the promise to love "until death do us part" doesn't make sense if "love" refers to a feeling, because feelings are not within one's control. The conclusion is that "love" in this context should not be taken to refer to feelings. This conclusion logically follows if we assume that people should not make promises to do something that is not within their control.
Action: Answer("B")

response:
